conclusion: Determine the longest propagation time of refracted light in the hemisphere.
Right triangle ABC with angle BAC = 90°, side lengths AB = AC = L, light beam incident on AB, enters hemisphere through BD, BD = L/4.
Use Snell's Law to determine refraction angle: n1 sin θ1 = n2 sin θ2.
Light beam is parallel to BC, makes angle θ1 with normal at D.
Calculate refracted path length as straight-line distance from D to exit point along diameter.
Radius of hemisphere R = L/√2 because BC = L√2.
Calculate time of propagation: t = s/v = s n2/c.
Maximum path length occurs along diameter of circle passing through D, length is 2R.
Final calculation: t = 2R n2/c, substitute R = L/√2.
Longest propagation time of refracted light in the hemisphere is 2.54L/c.
